works.description:
This is my personal and copyrighted
photo.  
Greg Ellison of www.theellisoncollection.com is using your his website for
 
harassment, Internet stalking, invasion of privacy, and torturous  
interference for the business expectancy of myself and other individuals. 

He is using personal and confidential information and my photo to harass  
myself and other individuals. I've already sent a request to Mr. Ellison  
and the website provider (Sonnar) and they will jot comply. Mr. Ellison is
 
escalating his harassment. My photo and information does not fit with an  
otherwise business-related website.  I ask that it be removed.


In the event that you would like some background regarding the events  
leading up to my request, I have taken the liberty of giving you a
summary.

I first encountered Greg Ellison last year when he attempted to sell me an
 
image he claimed could be identified as Jesse James. When I discovered  
there was no provenance or documentation for the photo, and that the image
 
didn't look much like the actual Jesse James, I declined Greg Ellison's  
business. When I declined and warned friends against purchasing or taking 

serious consideration of his photos, Ellison threatened me through email  
and forum postings. When this began, I learned that he had taken identical
 
actions against other individuals that have declined him as well,  
escalating to the point of calling home phone numbers and places of work. 

Because of his reputation of traversing various websites with his attempts
 
of fraud, threats and harassment, Greg Ellison is banned from historical  
forums including BJ's Tombstone Discussion, Jesse James Discussion Site,  
True West Magazine, Wild West Magazine, as well as ebay.




This behavior is consistent with Ellison's past public court records from 

Missouri and South Carolina. The judicial system for Horry County, South  
Carolina ruled against Ellison in two charges based on his conduct while  
the owner of a home and condo repair business. In 2000, Ellison was  
arrested when the state of South Carolina charged him with "Breach of
Trust  
with Fraudulent Intent." These public records also reveal that Ellison has
 
faced money judgements a total of nine times in Missouri and South  
Carolina. (http://www.horrycounty.org/SCJDWEB/publicindex/,
